verses.kjv: And it came to pass at that time, that Judah went down from his brethren, and turned in to a certain Adullamite, whose name was Hirah.
verses.ct: Around that time, Judah left his brothers and went to stay with a man from Adullam named Hirah.

verses.kjv: And Judah saw there a daughter of a certain Canaanite, whose name was Shuah; and he took her, and went in unto her.
verses.ct: While there, Judah noticed the daughter of a Canaanite man named Shuah. He married her and had relations with her.

verses.kjv: And she conceived, and bare a son; and he called his name Er.
verses.ct: She became pregnant and gave birth to a son, and he named him Er.

verses.kjv: And she conceived again, and bare a son; and she called his name Onan.
verses.ct: She became pregnant again and gave birth to another son, and she named him Onan.

verses.kjv: And she yet again conceived, and bare a son; and called his name Shelah: and he was at Chezib, when she bare him.
verses.ct: She became pregnant once more and gave birth to a son, and she named him Shelah. Judah was at Chezib when she gave birth to him.

verses.kjv: And Judah took a wife for Er his firstborn, whose name was Tamar.
verses.ct: Judah arranged a wife for his firstborn Er, a woman named Tamar.

verses.kjv: And Er, Judah’s firstborn, was wicked in the sight of the LORD; and the LORD slew him.
verses.ct: But Er, Judah's firstborn, was wicked in the LORD's sight, and the LORD killed him.

verses.kjv: And Judah said unto Onan, Go in unto thy brother’s wife, and marry her, and raise up seed to thy brother.
verses.ct: Then Judah told Onan, "Have relations with your brother's wife. Fulfill your duty as her brother-in-law and produce an heir for your brother."

verses.kjv: And Onan knew that the seed should not be his; and it came to pass, when he went in unto his brother’s wife, that he spilled it on the ground, lest that he should give seed to his brother.
verses.ct: But Onan knew that any child wouldn't be considered his. So whenever he had relations with his brother's wife, he spilled his semen on the ground to avoid producing an heir for his brother.

verses.kjv: And the thing which he did displeased the LORD: wherefore he slew him also.
verses.ct: What he did was offensive to the LORD, so the LORD killed him too.

verses.kjv: Then said Judah to Tamar his daughter in law, Remain a widow at thy father’s house, till Shelah my son be grown: for he said, Lest peradventure he die also, as his brethren did. And Tamar went and dwelt in her father’s house.
verses.ct: Then Judah told his daughter-in-law Tamar, "Go live as a widow in your father's house until my son Shelah grows up." He said this because he was afraid Shelah might die just like his brothers had. So Tamar went and lived in her father's house.

verses.kjv: And in process of time the daughter of Shuah Judah’s wife died; and Judah was comforted, and went up unto his sheepshearers to Timnath, he and his friend Hirah the Adullamite.
verses.ct: After a long time, Judah's wife, the daughter of Shuah, died. Once Judah had finished mourning, he traveled up to Timnath with his friend Hirah the Adullamite to be with his sheep shearers.

verses.kjv: And it was told Tamar, saying, Behold thy father in law goeth up to Timnath to shear his sheep.
verses.ct: Someone told Tamar, "Your father-in-law is heading up to Timnath to shear his sheep."

verses.kjv: And she put her widow’s garments off from her, and covered her with a vail, and wrapped herself, and sat in an open place, which is by the way to Timnath; for she saw that Shelah was grown, and she was not given unto him to wife.
verses.ct: So she took off her widow's clothing, covered herself with a veil to disguise herself, and sat down at the entrance to Enaim, which is on the road to Timnath. She did this because she realized that Shelah had grown up, yet she still hadn't been given to him as a wife.

verses.kjv: When Judah saw her, he thought her to be an harlot; because she had covered her face.
verses.ct: When Judah saw her, he assumed she was a prostitute because her face was covered.

verses.kjv: And he turned unto her by the way, and said, Go to, I pray thee, let me come in unto thee; (for he knew not that she was his daughter in law.) And she said, What wilt thou give me, that thou mayest come in unto me?
verses.ct: He went over to her by the road and said, "Come, let me have relations with you." He had no idea she was his daughter-in-law. She replied, "What will you give me for having relations with you?"

verses.kjv: And he said, I will send thee a kid from the flock. And she said, Wilt thou give me a pledge, till thou send it?
verses.ct: He said, "I'll send you a young goat from my flock." She asked, "Will you give me something as a guarantee until you send it?"

verses.kjv: And he said, What pledge shall I give thee? And she said, Thy signet, and thy bracelets, and thy staff that is in thine hand. And he gave it her, and came in unto her, and she conceived by him.
verses.ct: He asked, "What kind of guarantee do you want?" She answered, "Your seal, your cord, and the staff you're carrying." So he gave them to her, then had relations with her, and she became pregnant by him.

verses.kjv: And she arose, and went away, and laid by her vail from her, and put on the garments of her widowhood.
verses.ct: She got up and left, removed her veil, and put her widow's clothing back on.

verses.kjv: And Judah sent the kid by the hand of his friend the Adullamite, to receive his pledge from the woman’s hand: but he found her not.
verses.ct: Judah sent the young goat through his friend the Adullamite to get his items back from the woman, but his friend couldn't find her.

verses.kjv: Then he asked the men of that place, saying, Where is the harlot, that was openly by the way side? And they said, There was no harlot in this place.
verses.ct: He asked the local men, "Where is the prostitute who was sitting by the road at Enaim?" They answered, "There hasn't been any prostitute here."

verses.kjv: And he returned to Judah, and said, I cannot find her; and also the men of the place said, that there was no harlot in this place.
verses.ct: So he went back to Judah and reported, "I couldn't find her. The local men even said there was no prostitute in that area."

verses.kjv: And Judah said, Let her take it to her, lest we be shamed: behold, I sent this kid, and thou hast not found her.
verses.ct: Judah said, "Let her keep the items so we don't become a laughingstock. Look, I tried to send this young goat, but you couldn't find her."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass about three months after, that it was told Judah, saying, Tamar thy daughter in law hath played the harlot; and also, behold, she is with child by whoredom. And Judah said, Bring her forth, and let her be burnt.
verses.ct: About 3 months later, Judah received word: "Your daughter-in-law Tamar has been acting like a prostitute, and now she's pregnant because of it." Judah said, "Bring her out and have her burned!"

verses.kjv: When she was brought forth, she sent to her father in law, saying, By the man, whose these are, am I with child: and she said, Discern, I pray thee, whose are these, the signet, and bracelets, and staff.
verses.ct: As she was being brought out, she sent a message to her father-in-law: "The man who owns these things is the one who got me pregnant." She added, "Please examine these and identify whose seal, cord, and staff these are."

verses.kjv: And Judah acknowledged them, and said, She hath been more righteous than I; because that I gave her not to Shelah my son. And he knew her again no more.
verses.ct: Judah recognized them and said, "She is more in the right than I am, because I refused to give her to my son Shelah." He never had relations with her again.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass in the time of her travail, that, behold, twins were in her womb.
verses.ct: When the time came for her to deliver, it turned out there were twins in her womb.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, when she travailed, that the one put out his hand: and the midwife took and bound upon his hand a scarlet thread, saying, This came out first.
verses.ct: During the birth, one of them stuck out his hand. The midwife grabbed it and tied a scarlet thread around it, saying, "This one came out first."

verses.kjv: And it came to pass, as he drew back his hand, that, behold, his brother came out: and she said, How hast thou broken forth? this breach be upon thee: therefore his name was called Pharez.
verses.ct: But then he pulled his hand back, and his brother came out instead. She exclaimed, "What a breach you've made for yourself!" So he was named Perez.

verses.kjv: And afterward came out his brother, that had the scarlet thread upon his hand: and his name was called Zarah.
verses.ct: After that, his brother with the scarlet thread on his hand came out, and he was named Zarah.
